macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Starts 2026 with Mixed Gains as Tech Sector Drives Volatility
items.summary: U.S. stocks ended mixed on Friday, January 2, with the Dow rising 0.7% to 48,382, S&P 500 up 0.2% to 6,858, and Nasdaq nearly flat down less than 0.1% to 23,236, led by AI strength in Nvidia (+1.3%) but weighed by Microsoft (-2.2%) and Tesla (-2.6%) amid falling sales.

items.title: AI Stocks Fuel New Year's Rally After 2025 Slump; Baidu AI Unit Files for IPO
items.summary: Major indexes rose early Friday on AI sector strength, with chip stocks leading after Baidu's AI unit filed for IPO; Bitcoin climbed over 2% testing $90,000 while Berkshire Hathaway dipped slightly.

items.title: Markets Eye Fed Rate Cuts in 2026 Amid Dovish Expectations and Labor Data
items.summary: Analysts anticipate 2-3 Fed rate cuts in 2026 depending on labor market trajectory and December jobs report due January 9; markets price in easing policy with Dollar Index expected to fall 8-10%.

items.title: U.S. Markets Closed Sunday; Focus on China PMI and Central Bank Signals
items.summary: No U.S. trading or earnings on January 4 holiday; investors watch China December PMI showing services growth but weak industry, plus potential Fed/ECB comments on rates amid expectations of policy easing.

items.title: Tesla Reports Second Year of Falling Sales as Nasdaq Dips
items.summary: Tesla shares fell 2.6% Friday after disclosing declining sales for a second straight year, contributing to Nasdaq's flat close despite broader market gains.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Geoffrey Hinton Warns 2026 Could See Mass AI Job Displacement
items.summary: AI pioneer Geoffrey Hinton predicts 2026 as a potential tipping point for widespread job losses due to accelerating AI capabilities in knowledge work, faster deployment, and cost reductions threatening white-collar roles.

items.title: UCLA Researchers Develop Model-Free Reinforcement Learning for Optical AI Systems
items.summary: UCLA introduces a reinforcement learning framework using proximal policy optimization for in situ training of diffractive optical processors, enabling direct learning from real optical measurements without digital models, with applications in classification and hologram generation.

items.title: Render Network Sees Record Demand Amid AI-Driven Creative Shifts
items.summary: Cloud rendering demand surges to over 390 million frames processed in 2025, fueled by AI adoption among 2 million creators, though raising concerns over job displacement and ethical issues in creative industries.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Servers for Anthem, Warlander, and NBA Live 19 to Shut Down in January 2026
items.summary: Online servers for Anthem will close on January 12, making the game completely unavailable; Warlander shuts down January 20, and NBA Live 19 ends January 30. WWE 2K24 servers delayed to March, with removal from stores by end of January.

items.title: AMD FSR 4 Redstone: Complete List of Supported Games for January 2026
items.summary: AMD releases a full list of games supporting FSR 3.1 and FSR 3.1.4, including a step-by-step guide to enable FSR Redstone and required drivers as of January 2026.

items.title: Stardew Valley: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Released on NA eShop; Space Invaders Arcade Archives Hits 500th Release
items.summary: Stardew Valley: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition launched on North American eShops on Christmas Day with fixes incoming for Europe; Hamster releases Space Invaders as its 500th Arcade Archives title.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla loses world's largest EV seller status to BYD
items.summary: BYD overtook Tesla as the world's largest battery electric vehicle seller in 2025, reporting 2.25 million BEV sales (28% increase) compared to Tesla's 1.64 million units (8.5% decline). This marks the first time since 2018 that Tesla has lost the top position.

items.title: Big Tech faces growing community opposition to data center expansion
items.summary: Communities across the U.S. are increasingly blocking or delaying data center proposals, with 20 proposals valued at $98 billion blocked or delayed between April-June 2025. Local opposition over zoning, environmental concerns, and resource consumption is becoming a major obstacle to Big Tech's infrastructure expansion.
